Body: I was comparing the rear camera quality of two Android phones; The Samsung Galaxy S2 and Lenovo A7000.Both have the same camera specs,A7000: 8 MP, 3264 x 2448 pixels, autofocus, dual-LED flashGalaxy S2: 8 MP, 3264 x 2448 pixels, autofocus, LED flashWhen using apps like Snapchat or just Camera, I noticed that the A7000's picture quality is lesser (blurry) than that of the Galaxy S2. The pictures taken using the Lenovo aren't that great and the S2 has some really good quality. Why is it that when different phones have same camera spec, they don't capture images the same way?
Title: Why do different Android phones with the same camera specs have different picture quality?

history.Text: So I was comparing the rear camera quality of two Android phones; Samsung Galaxy S2 and Lenovo A7000.Both have the same camera specs,A7000: 8 MP, 3264 x 2448 pixels, autofocus, dual-LED flashSII: 8 MP, 3264 x 2448 pixels, autofocus, LED flashWhen using apps like Snapchat or just Camera, I noticed that the A7000's picture quality is lesser (blurry) than that of the GS2. The pictures taken using the Lenovo aren't that great and SII has some really good quality. Why is it that when different phones have same camera spec, they don't capture images the same way?
Why does different Android phones with same camera specs have different picture quality?
